body_html:
Could you try the following:

  1. use a model name without the character [], and:
  2. when you tried to restore, use the full relative path ./model_epoch10 rather than model_epoch10

If my guess is right then you should see it work. It it doesn't, could you give the steps so that people can reproduce the problem (i.e. how to use your code).
body_text:
Could you try the following:

use a model name without the character [], and:
when you tried to restore, use the full relative path ./model_epoch10 rather than model_epoch10

If my guess is right then you should see it work. It it doesn't, could you give the steps so that people can reproduce the problem (i.e. how to use your code).
body:
Could you try the following:
1. use a model name without the character `[]`, and:
2. when you tried to restore, use the full relative path `./model_epoch10` rather than `model_epoch10`

If my guess is right then you should see it work. It it doesn't, could you give the __steps__ so that people can reproduce the problem (i.e. how to use your code).
